channel.title: TOR - The deep web
channel.description:
Lately, I've been hearing some things about something called the "deep web", which is basically a mass quantity of data a typical browser in unable to access. Deep in this place, you'll find things such as drug trade, assassinations, banned books (and legal) available to your download, general black market items, and just a vast quantity of information. However, there are also some more dangerous things, such as CP In some countries, it has been used for uprisings and revolts. One of the few ways to access this is using [url=https://www.torproject.org/]https://www.torproject.org/[/url], in which data the original data are encrypted and re-encrypted multiple times, then sent through successive Tor relays, each one of which decrypts a "layer" of encryption before passing the data on to the next relay and ultimately the destination. From there, you can access many encrypted sites, ending in ".onion". Also, to those saying the FBI will hunt you down, they have much better things to do then stop some people searching through. Observation is generally ok, distribution is not, so don't do anything stupid.
So has anyone accessed this? I've never felt like going through all the security needed, but it seems like it would be fun.

item.dc:creator: @chillwitm888 chillwitm888
item.description:
@chillwitm888 wrote:

[quote=“ohiitsme”][quote author=chillwitm888 link=topic=526011.msg3830797#msg3830797 date=1322541455]

[quote author=ohiitsme link=topic=526011.msg3830794#msg3830794 date=1322541265]

[quote author=Saphire` link=topic=526011.msg3830793#msg3830793 date=1322541087]

So you want a program…that will just use even more memory? And people wonder why their computer lags

You didn’t read anything did you?
[/quote]I had no need to… I saw it was a download and knew . How else does it expect to " protect your privacy" it would have to obv run something

You’re completely wrong…
[/quote]just to make you happy I’ll download and prove it if it’s a browser plugin…then guess what that lags your browser. ( look at toolbars they do the same stuff )

No its a seperate Browser, You run a browser with a Proxy, everytime You restart the server viadialia CP you get a new Ip.
[/quote]im still downloading it but…I can go ahead and say this then if it’s a browser it will be eating more memory than other common browsers that are used. So either way I was right…more memory will be used.[/quote]
WELL, =.= EVERYTHING you download or use Will USE more memory, why don’t you just let a computer sit there and it will use the least memory, like if that’s what you mean.

Read full topic

item.title: TOR - The deep web
item.dc:creator: @Saphire1 Saphire`
item.description:
@Saphire1 wrote:

I remember reading this before, let me get some facts about deep web.

· Public information on the deep Web is currently 400 to 550 times larger than the commonly defined World Wide Web.

· The deep Web contains 7,500 terabytes of information compared to 19 terabytes of information in the surface Web.

· The deep Web contains nearly 550 billion individual documents compared to the 1 billion of the surface Web.

· More than 200,000 deep Web sites presently exist.

· Sixty of the largest deep-Web sites collectively contain about 750 terabytes of information — sufficient by themselves to exceed the size of the surface Web forty times.

· The deep Web is the largest growing category of new information on the Internet.

· Deep Web sites tend to be narrower, with deeper content, than conventional surface sites.

· Total quality content of the deep Web is 1,000 to 2,000 times greater than that of the surface Web.

· Deep Web content is highly relevant to every information need, market, and domain.

· More than half of the deep Web content resides in topic-specific databases.

· A full ninety-five per cent of the deep Web is publicly accessible information — not subject to fees or subscriptions.

Read full topic
